(ร้อยเอ็ด) is a town in

Roi Et is both a city and a province located in the mid-northeast Thailand. Established over 200 years ago, it used to be a very large and glorious city named Saket Nakhon having 11 city gates and 11 satellite cities or subordinated communities under its rule. 

Roi Et occupies an area of 8,299.50 square kilometres.

The recorded history of Muang Roi Et began during the late Ayutthaya period, when a king of Laos and his people migrated from Champasak City to settle down in the area which is currently Suwannaphum. Later, during the reign of King Taksin of Thon Buri, Roi Et was moved to its present site. Suwannaphum is still at its original location.

Take Hwy 1 (Phahonyothin Rd) from Bangkok, turn onto Hwy 2 (Mittraphap Rd) at Saraburi Province heading toward Korat, passing Ban Phai district, Maha Sarakham, until reaching Roi Et. The total distance is about 512 km and takes about 7 hours.
Nok Air flies 7 days a week to Roi Et (ROI) from Don Mueang Airport (DMK).

From Bangkok's Mo Chit Bus Terminal there are several ordinary and air conditioned buses going to Roi Et. There is also a bus route from Rayong via Pattaya-Nakhon Ratchasima-Buriram-Roi Et to Mukdahan on the Lao border. From Khon Kaen, air-con bus to Roi Et, pink colour.
. From there, catch a bus to Roi Et (pink colour). For more details, contact the
Take a samlor ("three wheels") to get around. You will find samlors near markets, hotels, the bus station and in the city centre. Prices are normally between 20-50 baht.

value: directions=On Hwy 23, around the km145 marker
content=Villagers here earn their living by making silk cloth under a cooperative set-up for joint marketing. The products from this village have won several awards for their quality.

content=The lake, in the heart of Roi Et township, is regarded the symbol of the province. It features an island in a large lake occupying an approximate area of 200,000 square meters. It boasts a large flower garden shaded by various species of trees. There are fish in the lake and rowboats are available. Inside the area:

:* City Pillar Shrine  which is highly revered by locals.
:* Large Walking Buddha image located in the garden.
:* Pedestal in the form of a long legged bowl, containing a constitution book and floral clock.
:* Phu Phalan Chai featuring an zoo and artificial waterfall.
:* Health corner where people exercise.
:* Children's playground.
name=Roi Et Somdet Phra Srinakharin Park
directions=In the heart of the town in front of the provincial administrative building (Sala Klang)

content=A public park of about 225 rai (36 hectares). The park is dotted with floral gardens and shade trees. The centrepiece of the park is the fountain springing up high in the middle of the park. The white clock tower in the centre of the park is graceful and beautiful. There is a library for the public at this tower too. It's used for various festivals and entertainment activities of the province.

content=This monastery houses Thailand's tallest Buddha image in the attitude of blessing, called "Phra Phuttha Ratana Mongkhon Maha Muni". The image is built of reinforced concrete and under its base there are several museum chambers. The height of the statue from the foot to the top of the finial is 59 m 20 cm.

content=This monastery is very old and is presumed to have been built before the foundation of Roi Et. Its main shrine hall was built in the late Ayutthaya period. It was used for oath taking ceremonies in the past. At present, this monastery is utilized as a Buddhist school and as a place where annual examinations on Buddhist faith takes place. There are beautiful and valuable mural paintings concerning the Lord Buddha's biography on the inside walls of main shrine hall.
directions=About 70 km from Roi Et on Hwy 2044 and 2136
content=A huge, beautiful temple on a small mountain with sweeping views of the surrounding countryside.

Handicrafts are the province's main product, particularly the Isaan khaen, a kind of panpipe made from wood and reeds. The best ones are made in the small village of Si Kaew. 

Phadung Phanit Rd is a good place to buy silk and cotton fabric.

value: content=If you need an experienced tourist guide. He speaks Thai, Lao, English, German, Swedish, Norwegian, and Danish.
content=The Danish/Thai owners have created a relaxed meeting place for local expats and tourists. Thai and Western  food, snooker, satellite TV, music.
content=A well known take-away street restaurant in Roi Et. The owners are two Thai ladies, Gai and Pai, and they prepare excellent original Isaan food and they speak English.
directions=On the street that circles the lake in the middle of Roi Et
content=Good Western food: pizza, burgers. Service is great by friendly staff. Owned by Aun and Paul.
content=Over 30 different toppings and a selection of cheese blends and appetizers.
content=Premium ice cream in hundreds of flavours.

The bus leaves from Roi Et Terminal at Thawa Phiban Rd, Tel. +66 43 511939, +66 43 512546.
